title: Stocks rise after strong Microsoft and Tesla earnings
text:
Stocks opened higher on Thursday as strong earnings from Microsoft and Tesla lifted investor sentiment.

The Dow Jones Industrial Average traded 67 points higher at the open, or 0.3%. The S&P 500 gained 0.4%, inching closer to a record high. The Nasdaq Composite climbed 0.7%.

Microsoft reported earnings per share of $1.38 on revenue of $33.06 billion for the previous quarter. Analysts polled by Refinitiv expected a profit of $1.25 per share on revenue of $32.23 billion. Microsoft's strong quarterly performance was driven in part by Azure, its cloud business, which saw revenues grow by 59% on a year-over-year basis. The stock rose 1.4%.

"MSFT delivered strength across the board with no blemishes and importantly gave stronger than expected December quarter guidance which speaks to an inflection point in deal flow as more enterprises pick Redmond for the cloud," Dan Ives, an analyst at Wedbush Securities, said in a note.

Tesla shares spiked more than 19% after the electric car maker posted a surprise quarterly profit. The company also told investors its new Shanghai factor is "ready for production."
description: Stocks opened higher on Thursday as strong earnings from Microsoft and Tesla lifted investor sentiment.
